description: If n = p_1^e_1 *p_2^e_2 *p_3^e_3..., p's = distinct primes, e's = positive integers, then a(n) = p_1^(e_1^2) *p_2^(e_2^2) *p_3^(e_3^2) ... .
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: a:= n-> mul(i[1]^(i[2]^2), i=ifactors(n)[2]):seq(a(n), n=1..50);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 09 2014
prog: (Haskell)a054496 n = product $            zipWith (^) (a027748_row n) (map a000290 $ a124010_row n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 27 2013(PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,2] = f[i, 2]^2); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 09 2014
author: _Leroy Quet_, May 14 2000
